title: A box contains 4 red balls, 3 blue balls and 5 yellow balls. In how many ways will 5 balls be selected so as there will be exactly 3 red balls? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are 12 balls in the box of which 4 are red, 3 are blue and 5 are yellow. Now, there will be 3 situations where out of 5 balls drawn there will be exactly 3 red balls are (i) 3 red balls and 2 blue balls (ii) 3 red balls and 2 yellow balls and (iii) 3 red balls and 1 ball each of blue and yellow. You have to select 5 balls out of which exact 3 balls should be red, so why not first select red balls only, we will think of remaining later…. We have to select 3 Red balls out of 4, so the number of ways is 4C3 = 4!/(3!1!) = 4.Now as we have chosen the 3 red balls, 2 remaining balls have to be selected out of 8 balls (3 blue+ 5 yellow), so the number of ways is = 8C2=8!/(6!2!)= 28.Now to get the final answer, multiply Ans1 with Ans2 as both things have to be done = 4 * 28 = 112. I hope you understood it.
you have 4C3 or 4 ways of choosing the 3 red ballsyou have 8C2 or 28 ways of choosing the two other ballsyou therefore have 4 x 28 =112 ways of choosing exactly 3 red balls

If exactly 3 red balls are selected among 5, then the remaining 2 selected balls may be both blue, both yellow, or one blue and one yellow. So I would say that there are 3 ways of 5 balls being selected so as there will be exactly 3 red balls.
